bestBHT.bht: The penetrating and diffusive power of hypocrisy is captured in the comparison to leaven. Both the Pharisees and Sadducees were influenced by this leaven, despite their external differences. The false doctrines taught by the Pharisees, including the traditions of men and justification by works, resembled leaven that could spread and infect others. The disciples were warned to be watchful and guard against this leaven, lest they be affected by the hypocrisy and false teachings of these religious leaders.

Henry Alford: It is from the penetrating and diffusive power of leaven that the comparison, whether for good or bad, is derived.
Hypocrisy is of all evil things the most penetrating and diffusive.
Their leaven was the same - hypocrisy - however it might be disguised by external difference of sentiment.
Philip Schaff: ‘Leaven; ‘figure for a permeating spiritual influence, generally an evil one.
Their want of bread made the illustration apt.
Politicians often coquet with religious parties.
John Gill: By 'the leaven' of these is meant their doctrine."
The doctrines the Pharisees taught were the commandments and inventions of men, the traditions of the elders, free will, and justification by the works of the law."
Christ compares them to leaven; and advises his disciples to look about them, to watch, and be on their guard, lest they should be infected with them.
John Wesley: Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees — That is, of their false doctrine.
This is elegantly so called; for it spreads in the soul, or the Church, as leaven does in meal.

bhtAttempts.bht: Hypocrisy, like leaven, has the power to penetrate and spread its influence. It is this penetrating and diffusive nature that is captured in the comparison made in this verse. Despite external differences, both the Pharisees and Sadducees were influenced by the same leaven of hypocrisy. Their teachings, which included the traditions of men and justification through works, were compared to leaven. Just as leaven spreads in meal, the false doctrine of the Pharisees had the potential to infect the souls of the disciples. Hence, they were warned to be vigilant and guard against this leaven.

The comparison in this passage highlights the penetrating and diffusive nature of hypocrisy. Both the Pharisees and Sadducees were influenced by this leaven, even though their external beliefs and practices may have differed. The false teachings of the Pharisees, including the traditions of men and justification by works, were like leaven that could spread and infect the souls of the disciples. Therefore, they were urged to remain watchful and guard against this insidious influence.

From the penetrating and diffusive power of leaven, we can understand the comparison being made. Hypocrisy, being the most penetrating and diffusive of all evils, is likened to leaven. Although disguised by external differences, the Pharisees and Sadducees shared the same leaven of hypocrisy. Their teachings, rooted in the traditions and works of men, were like leaven that could spread and infect others. The disciples were thus advised to remain vigilant and guard against this false doctrine, lest they too be affected.

The penetrating and diffusive power of hypocrisy is captured in the comparison to leaven. Both the Pharisees and Sadducees were influenced by this leaven, despite their external differences. The false doctrines taught by the Pharisees, including the traditions of men and justification by works, resembled leaven that could spread and infect others. The disciples were warned to be watchful and guard against this leaven, lest they be affected by the hypocrisy and false teachings of these religious leaders.

The comparison in this verse emphasizes the penetrating and diffusive nature of hypocrisy, which is likened to leaven. Both the Pharisees and Sadducees were influenced by the same leaven of hypocrisy, regardless of external differences. The false doctrines taught by the Pharisees, such as the traditions of men and justification through works, resembled leaven that could spread and infect others. The disciples were warned to be on guard lest they too become affected by the leaven of hypocrisy and false teachings.
